definitions: Refusing to give up or let go; persevering obstinately.
Insistently repetitive or continuous.
Existing or remaining in the same state for an indefinitely long time; enduring.
Having or showing much worldly knowledge or cultural refinement.
Very complex or complicated.
Inclined to tolerate the beliefs or behavior of others; forbearing.
Able to withstand or endure an adverse environmental condition.
Characterized by much activity and vigor, especially in bringing about change; energetic and forceful.
Characterized by continuous change, activity, or progress.
Careful in thought, full of concern, or restrained and dignified in manner; somber or grave.
Requiring or carried out with careful thought or concern; Sober.
Responding especially readily and sympathetically to appeals, efforts, and influences.
Quick to respond.
Commanding, controlling, or prevailing over all others.
Occupying or being in a commanding or elevated position.
Having or showing confidence and poise.
confident in one's own abilities.
Assured by or of one's self; self-reliant; complacent.
Characterized by a ready capability to adapt to new, different, or changing requirements.
Yielding to influence.
Standing out from a group.
Marked by eminence and distinction.
Noticeable.
Excellent or exceptional good.
Liking competition or inclined to compete.
Inclined, desiring, or suited to be in a state of rivalry.
To strive consciously or unconsciously for an objective (as position, profit, or a prize).
Possessing or displaying courage.
Having or showing mental or moral strength to face danger, fear, or difficulty.
Respected; having respect or admiration from others.
Having an illustrious reputation.
To be regarded highly or favorably; regarded with respect or admiration.
Marked by enthusiastic desire.
Marked by impatient interest.
Having or showing keen interest, intense desire, or impatient expectancy.
Of a pleasant disposition; friendly and sociable.
Sociable; Genial.
Friendly and pleasant.
Conducive to or promoting social or moral well-being, especially in reflecting conventional moral values. (sound in body, mind, or morals)
Conducive to or indicative of good health or well-being or spirit.
Given to, marked by, or arising from sympathy, compassion, friendliness, and sensitivity to others' emotions.
Existing or operating through an affinity, interdependence, or mutual association.
Easy and informal in manner.
Not rigorous or strict.
Free from strain or tension.
Having power to convince [persuade] of the truth, rightness, or reality of something
Serving to convince; persuasive or believable.
Being able to make one believe that something is true or right.
Widely liked or appreciated.
Liked by acquaintances; sought after for company.
Inclined to undertake new and daring enterprises.
Characterized by boldness or daring; hazardous; risky.
Inclined or willing to incur hazard or engage in adventures; bold to encounter danger; daring; venturesome; courageous; enterprising.
Inclined to persist in a state, enterprise, or undertaking in spite of counterinfluences, opposition, or discouragement.
Resolutely persistent; steadfast.
Incline to continue effort to do or achieve something despite difficulties, failure, or opposition.
Pleasing and agreeable in nature.
Exhibiting courtesy and politeness.
Having a pleasant or attractive appearance.
Being in or characterized by good spirits; merry.
Promoting a feeling of cheer; pleasant.
Of good cheer; having good spirits; lively.
Conforming to established practice or accepted standards; traditional.
Conforming or adhering to accepted standards, as of conduct or taste.
Following the accepted customs and proprieties, especially in a way that lacks originality.
Full of love for and goodwill toward others; benevolent.
Merciful or kind in judging others.
Generous in giving money or other help to the needy.
Attractive; inviting.
Interesting.
Evoking or attracting interest, desire, curiosity, or sympathy.
Having or exhibiting the qualities of a friendly neighbor.
Friendly; amicable.
Having characteristics appropriate of neighbors:  kind, friend, sociable, and so on.
Inclined to be bold or confident assertion; aggressively self-assured.
Disposed to or characterized by bold or confident statements and behavior.
Behaving confidently; unafraid to speak one's mind.
Considerate or kindly in disposition; amiable and tender.
Free from harshness, sternness, or violence.
Calm, kind, or soft; docile.
